intro: Elegia namaquensis, commonly known as the Namibian starflower, is a succulent plant native to the Namib Desert. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, known for its distinctive flowering structures and adaptations to arid environments. The plant features fleshy, cylindrical stems that store water, and its leaves are often reduced to small scales. It produces star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and white, typically blooming after rainfall. Elegia namaquensis thrives in well-drained sandy soils and is adapted to extreme temperature fluctuations.
